author: S P
text:
A total of 79 people involved in various crime activities were detained under the Goondas Act in the district in 2015.

Senior police officials said that it was the highest in any districts coming under the jurisdiction of West Zone, Coimbatore.

The year 2015 started off with protests by Hindutva and caste outfits over Perumal Murugan’s controversial novel ‘Madhorubagan’ in Tiruchengode. Sensational cases including the murder of V. Gokulraj and the suicide of Tiruchengode Sub-Division DSP R. Vishnupriya kept the police on their toes in the district.

The police also had a tough time when law and order problem broke out over temple disputes that resulted in caste-related clashes.

Based on the recommendations of Superintendent of Police S.R. Senthil Kumar, Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy ordered the detention of 79 people in 2015.

Detainees under the Act include four persons in illegal possession of arms case in Thinnanur Nadu in Kolli Hills; five persons for gang rape of woman in Namagiripettai; three for throwing petrol bomb in petrol bunk; seven persons in Gokulraj murder case; five persons in a businessman’s murder case at Pallipalayam; four persons in double murder case at Elachipalayam; one person for throwing acid on a nurse at Manickampalayam, and one for murdering a lorry owner at Nallipalayam.
title: Goondas Act: 79 detained in 2015
